column4: need some help with lid actions on ubuntu 10.04... laptop lid-close/open: suspend/hibernate doesn't work. can anyone help? thanks
how much ram do you have?
and how much swap do you have?
ok, thought i'd try the simplest problem
and you have it set to suspend/hibernate in the power settings when you close the lid?
well then i can't help you
i think swap is for hibernation, suspension is to ram
you're not using any special boot parameters are you?
acpi
sorry, i meant acpi options can be set at boot, hence my question about boot parameters
if acpi was off then the lid action wouldn't be regestered/recognised
whats the output of: lsmod
copy and paste it to a paste site
pastebin.com
hmm, i can't see any reference to acpi in there
i guess it depends on your model, i use thinkpads so i have thinkpad_acpi listed in lsmod
maybe your equivilant is sony_laptop
i don't know enough to be of help sorry
maybe sony_laptop is your acpi module, like thinkpad_acpi is mine
yeah, neither do i
that would be the kernel's job
